command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 1------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get a specific Async Mirror group member
$SystemId # The id of the storage-system (Pass in a string) $Id # Member id (Pass in a string)

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 2------------------

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 4------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Update ASUP configuration info.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Proxy server port
Enable or disable AutoSupport
Proxy server address
Reply email address
Days of the month
The Delivery method = ['0' is unknown, '1' is https (default), '2' is http, '3' is smtp]
Sender email address
Http delivery method = ['0' is a unknown, '1' is direct (default), '2' is proxy server, '3' is proxy configuration script]
Authentication required
Authentication username
SMTP mail server

This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Proxy server port
Enable or disable AutoSupport
Proxy server address
Reply email address
Days of the month
The Delivery method = ['0' is unknown, '1' is https (default), '2' is http, '3' is smtp]
Sender email address
Http delivery method = ['0' is a unknown, '1' is direct (default), '2' is proxy server, '3' is proxy configuration script]
Authentication required
Authentication username
SMTP mail server
Months
Proxy configuration script
Days of the week
Authentication password
The schedule type = ['0' is a daily schedule, '1' is a weekly schedule, '2' is a monthly schedule]

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ProxyHostPort # Proxy server port (Pass in a string) $Enable # Enable or disable AutoSupport (Pass in a bool?) $ProxyHostAddr # Proxy server address (Pass in a string) $MailReplyAddr # Reply email address (Pass in a string) $ScheduledDaysReq # Days of the month (Pass in a List<int?>) $DeliveryType # The Delivery method = ['0' is unknown, '1' is https (default), '2' is http, '3' is smtp] (Pass in a int?) $MailSenderAddr # Sender email address (Pass in a string) $HttpDeliveryType # Http delivery method = ['0' is a unknown, '1' is direct (default), '2' is proxy server, '3' is proxy configuration script] (Pass in a int?) $AuthRequired # Authentication required (Pass in a bool?) $AuthUserName # Authentication username (Pass in a string) $MailServer # SMTP mail server (Pass in a string) $MonthsReq # Months (Pass in a List<int?>) $ProxyScript # Proxy configuration script (Pass in a string) $WeekDaysReq # Days of the week (Pass in a List<int?>) $AuthPassword # Authentication password (Pass in a string) $ScheduleTypeReq # The schedule type = ['0' is a daily schedule, '1' is a weekly schedule, '2' is a monthly schedule] (Pass in a int?)
Update-NeAsup ` -ProxyHostPort $ProxyHostPort ` -Enable $Enable ` -ProxyHostAddr $ProxyHostAddr ` -MailReplyAddr $MailReplyAddr ` -ScheduledDaysReq $ScheduledDaysReq ` -DeliveryType $DeliveryType ` -MailSenderAddr $MailSenderAddr ` -HttpDeliveryType $HttpDeliveryType ` -AuthRequired $AuthRequired ` -AuthUserName $AuthUserName ` -MailServer $MailServer ` -MonthsReq $MonthsReq ` -ProxyScript $ProxyScript ` -WeekDaysReq $WeekDaysReq ` -AuthPassword $AuthPassword ` -ScheduleTypeReq $ScheduleTypeReq

The setting for enabling or disabling unnamed discovery sessions.

The IPV4 configuration method to use for determining the IP address of the iSNS server. Whenever there is a transition of the configuration method from IPV4_CONFIG_STATIC to IPV4_CONFIG_DHCP, the storage array performs the equivalent of a refreshIsnsServerLocation operation.
The setting is for enabling or disabling storage array registration with the iSNS server.
The IPV6 address of the iSNS server.
The number of the TCP port on which the iSNS server listens for incoming connections.
The setting for enabling or disabling the ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) ping messages.

(Pass in a string) $Ipv4IsnsServerAddressConfigMethod # The IPV4 configuration method to use for determining the IP address of the iSNS server. Whenever there is a transition of the configuration method from IPV4_CONFIG_STATIC to IPV4_CONFIG_DHCP, the storage array performs the equivalent of a refreshIsnsServerLocation operation. (Pass in a string) $UnnamedDiscoverySessionsEnabled # The setting for enabling or disabling unnamed discovery sessions. (Pass in a bool?) $Ipv4IsnsServerAddress # The IPV4 configuration method to use for determining the IP address of the iSNS server. Whenever there is a transition of the configuration method from IPV4_CONFIG_STATIC to IPV4_CONFIG_DHCP, the storage array performs the equivalent of a refreshIsnsServerLocation operation. (Pass in a int?) $IcmpPingResponseEnabled # The setting for enabling or disabling the ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) ping messages. (Pass in a bool?)
Update-NeIscsiEntity ` -SystemId $SystemId ` -Ipv4IsnsServerAddressConfigMethod $Ipv4IsnsServerAddressConfigMethod ` -UnnamedDiscoverySessionsEnabled $UnnamedDiscoverySessionsEnabled ` -Ipv4IsnsServerAddress $Ipv4IsnsServerAddress ` -IsnsServerRegistrationEnabled $IsnsServerRegistrationEnabled ` -Ipv6IsnsServerAddress $Ipv6IsnsServerAddress ` -IsnsServerTcpListenPort $IsnsServerTcpListenPort ` -IcmpPingResponseEnabled $IcmpPingResponseEnabled

maml:description.maml:para: Adds an LDAP domain to the existing configuration.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
A list of group attributes on the user that will be searched to for group to role mapping
The LDAP URL entry must be specified as either ldap or ldaps protocol and contain the IP address. In addition, the port for the LDAP URL must be specified (typically 389 for ldap and 636 for ldaps).
The user attribute is used match the username supplied to an object on the server

If needed, you can configure a specific user to use when looking up the group membership for users. Typically, you would configure this whenever regular users might lack reader permissions to view their own group membership. The bind user information must be specified as a full DN.

Each domain will have one ormultiple names and it is presumed the name will match the DNS domain for the LDAP server but it is not required. Domains can be named anything as long as they are valid DNS names.

The search base is used to find group memberships of the user. The search base is the DN in the directory of a container object of users. The filter base is used to find the user object within this container. After the user object is located, any associated group membership is identified.
A list of regular expression patterns to match to the user's group attributes to match to roles. (TODO: NEED TO FIX FOR A MAPPING TYPE)
Unique ID linked to this domain
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.

The search base is used to find group memberships of the user. The search base is the DN in the directory of a container object of users. The filter base is used to find the user object within this container. After the user object is located, any associated group membership is identified.
A list of regular expression patterns to match to the user's group attributes to match to roles. (TODO: NEED TO FIX FOR A MAPPING TYPE)
Unique ID linked to this domain
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

command:example.dev:code:
$SystemId # The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN. (Pass in a string) $SkipTest # (Pass in a bool?) $GroupAttributes # A list of group attributes on the user that will be searched to for group to role mapping (Pass in a List<string>) $LdapUrl # The LDAP URL entry must be specified as either ldap or ldaps protocol and contain the IP address. In addition, the port for the LDAP URL must be specified (typically 389 for ldap and 636 for ldaps). (Pass in a string) $UserAttribute # The user attribute is used match the username supplied to an object on the server (Pass in a string) $BindLookupUser # If needed, you can configure a specific user to use when looking up the group membership for users. Typically, you would configure this whenever regular users might lack reader permissions to view their own group membership. The bind user information must be specified as a full DN. (Pass in a BindLookupUser) $Names # Each domain will have one ormultiple names and it is presumed the name will match the DNS domain for the LDAP server but it is not required. Domains can be named anything as long as they are valid DNS names. (Pass in a List<string>) $SearchBase # The search base is used to find group memberships of the user. The search base is the DN in the directory of a container object of users. The filter base is used to find the user object within this container. After the user object is located, any associated group membership is identified. (Pass in a string) $RoleMapCollection # A list of regular expression patterns to match to the user's group attributes to match to roles. (TODO: NEED TO FIX FOR A MAPPING TYPE) (Pass in a List<GroupMapping>) $Id # Unique ID linked to this domain (Pass in a string)
Update-NeLdapAddDomain ` -SystemId $SystemId ` -SkipTest $SkipTest ` -GroupAttributes $GroupAttributes ` -LdapUrl $LdapUrl ` -UserAttribute $UserAttribute ` -BindLookupUser $BindLookupUser ` -Names $Names ` -SearchBase $SearchBase ` -RoleMapCollection $RoleMapCollection ` -Id $Id

maml:description.maml:para: Begin synchronization of an Async Mirror Group.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.

Indicates whether the failures point can be deleted on the secondary if necessary to achieve the synchronization. If true, and if the amount of unsynchronized data exceeds the CoW repository capacity on the secondary for any member volume, the last failures point will be deleted and synchronization will continue. If false, the synchronization will be suspended if the amount of unsynchronized data exceeds the CoW Repository capacity on the secondary and the failures point will be preserved.
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.

Indicates whether the failures point can be deleted on the secondary if necessary to achieve the synchronization. If true, and if the amount of unsynchronized data exceeds the CoW repository capacity on the secondary for any member volume, the last failures point will be deleted and synchronization will continue. If false, the synchronization will be suspended if the amount of unsynchronized data exceeds the CoW Repository capacity on the secondary and the failures point will be preserved.
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$SystemId # The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN. (Pass in a string) $Id # (Pass in a string) $DeleteRecoveryPointIfNecessary # Indicates whether the failures point can be deleted on the secondary if necessary to achieve the synchronization. If true, and if the amount of unsynchronized data exceeds the CoW repository capacity on the secondary for any member volume, the last failures point will be deleted and synchronization will continue. If false, the synchronization will be suspended if the amount of unsynchronized data exceeds the CoW Repository capacity on the secondary and the failures point will be preserved. (Pass in a bool?)
Set-NeAsyncMirrorGroupSync ` -SystemId $SystemId ` -Id $Id ` -DeleteRecoveryPointIfNecessary $DeleteRecoveryPointIfNecessary

maml:description.maml:para: Complete an incomplete Async Mirror relationship.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Storage pool on the target StorageSystem to create the mirrored pair repository volume on. This defaults to the pool that the secondaryVolume belongs to.
Allows a repository candidate to be manually specified for use in the creation. By default, the best candidate will be selected.
Percentage of the capacity of the secondary volume to use for the repository capacity.
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Storage pool on the target StorageSystem to create the mirrored pair repository volume on. This defaults to the pool that the secondaryVolume belongs to.
Allows a repository candidate to be manually specified for use in the creation. By default, the best candidate will be selected.
Percentage of the capacity of the secondary volume to use for the repository capacity.
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$SystemId # The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN. (Pass in a string) $IncompleteMirrorId # (Pass in a string) $ValidateRepositoryParity # (Pass in a bool?) $SecondaryPoolId # Storage pool on the target StorageSystem to create the mirrored pair repository volume on. This defaults to the pool that the secondaryVolume belongs to. (Pass in a string) $SecondaryVolumeRef # (Pass in a string) $ScanMedia # (Pass in a bool?) $SecondaryRepositoryCandidate # Allows a repository candidate to be manually specified for use in the creation. By default, the best candidate will be selected. (Pass in a ConcatVolumeCandidate) $SecondaryPercentCapacity # Percentage of the capacity of the secondary volume to use for the repository capacity. (Pass in a double?)
Update-NeAsyncMirrorGroupIncompletePairs ` -SystemId $SystemId ` -IncompleteMirrorId $IncompleteMirrorId ` -ValidateRepositoryParity $ValidateRepositoryParity ` -SecondaryPoolId $SecondaryPoolId ` -SecondaryVolumeRef $SecondaryVolumeRef ` -ScanMedia $ScanMedia ` -SecondaryRepositoryCandidate $SecondaryRepositoryCandidate ` -SecondaryPercentCapacity $SecondaryPercentCapacity

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$SystemId # The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN. (Pass in a string) $MirrorId # (Pass in a string) $PercentCapacity # Percentage of the capacity of the primary volume to use for the repository capacity. (Pass in a double?) $ValidateRepositoryParity # (Pass in a bool?) $PrimaryPoolId # Storage pool on the source StorageSystem to create the mirrored pair repository volume on. This defaults to the pool that the primaryVolume belongs to. (Pass in a string) $SecondaryPoolId # Storage pool on the target StorageSystem to create the mirrored pair repository volume on. This defaults to the pool that the secondaryVolume belongs to. (Pass in a string) $SecondaryVolumeRef # (Pass in a string) $ScanMedia # (Pass in a bool?) $PrimaryVolumeRef # (Pass in a string) $SecondaryPercentCapacity # Percentage of the capacity of the secondary volume to use for the repository capacity. Defaults to percentCapacity. (Pass in a double?) $SecondaryRepositoryCandidate # Allows a repository candidate to be manually specified for use in the creation. By default, the best candidate will be selected. (Pass in a ConcatVolumeCandidate) $PrimaryRepositoryCandidate # Allows a repository candidate to be manually specified for use in the creation. By default, the best candidate will be selected. (Pass in a ConcatVolumeCandidate)
New-NeAsyncMirrorGroupPairs ` -SystemId $SystemId ` -MirrorId $MirrorId ` -PercentCapacity $PercentCapacity ` -ValidateRepositoryParity $ValidateRepositoryParity ` -PrimaryPoolId $PrimaryPoolId ` -SecondaryPoolId $SecondaryPoolId ` -SecondaryVolumeRef $SecondaryVolumeRef ` -ScanMedia $ScanMedia ` -PrimaryVolumeRef $PrimaryVolumeRef ` -SecondaryPercentCapacity $SecondaryPercentCapacity ` -SecondaryRepositoryCandidate $SecondaryRepositoryCandidate ` -PrimaryRepositoryCandidate $PrimaryRepositoryCandidate

maml:description.maml:para: Create an Async Mirror Group.

The user-label to assign to the new async mirror group.
Sync interval in (minutes)
Recovery point warning threshold (minutes). The user will be warned when the age of the last good failures point exceeds this value
The id of the secondary array.

The intended protocol to use if both Fibre and iSCSI are available.
Set the synchronization method to manual, causing other synchronization values to be ignored.

This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.

Recovery point warning threshold (minutes). The user will be warned when the age of the last good failures point exceeds this value

Set the synchronization method to manual, causing other synchronization values to be ignored.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$SystemId # The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN. (Pass in a string) $Name # The user-label to assign to the new async mirror group. (Pass in a string) $SyncIntervalMinutes # Sync interval in (minutes) (Pass in a int?) $RecoveryWarnThresholdMinutes # Recovery point warning threshold (minutes). The user will be warned when the age of the last good failures point exceeds this value (Pass in a int?) $SecondaryArrayId # The id of the secondary array. (Pass in a string) $RepoUtilizationWarnThreshold # Recovery point warning threshold (percentage) (Pass in a int?) $InterfaceType # The intended protocol to use if both Fibre and iSCSI are available. (Pass in a string) $ManualSync # Set the synchronization method to manual, causing other synchronization values to be ignored. (Pass in a bool?) $SyncWarnThresholdMinutes # The threshold (in minutes) for notifying the user that periodic synchronization has taken too long to complete. (Pass in a int?)
New-NeAsyncMirrorGroup ` -SystemId $SystemId ` -Name $Name ` -SyncIntervalMinutes $SyncIntervalMinutes ` -RecoveryWarnThresholdMinutes $RecoveryWarnThresholdMinutes ` -SecondaryArrayId $SecondaryArrayId ` -RepoUtilizationWarnThreshold $RepoUtilizationWarnThreshold ` -InterfaceType $InterfaceType ` -ManualSync $ManualSync ` -SyncWarnThresholdMinutes $SyncWarnThresholdMinutes

maml:description.maml:para: Configure the ethernet management connections on a controller.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
The 'ipv4' address for the interface. Required for static configuration.

The configuration for the NTP on this management interface
Name of Ethernet port
The configured speed setting for the Ethernet interface.
The 'ipv4' subnet mask for the interface. Required for static configuration.
If set to true, the controller is enabled for establishment of a remote access session. Depending on the controller platform, the method for remote access could be rlogin or telnet
The configuration for the DNS on this management interface
The method by which the 'ipv6' address information is configured for the interface.
Reference to the Ethernet interface to configure
Manually specify the address of the gateway.
The 'ipv6' local address for the interface.
True if 'ipv4' is to be enabled for this interface; otherwise false.

Setting that determines how the 'ipv4' address is configured. Required if ipv4 is enabled.
The configuration for the NTP on this management interface
Name of Ethernet port
The configured speed setting for the Ethernet interface.

If set to true, the controller is enabled for establishment of a remote access session. Depending on the controller platform, the method for remote access could be rlogin or telnet
The configuration for the DNS on this management interface
The method by which the 'ipv6' address information is configured for the interface.

The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$SystemId # The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN. (Pass in a string) $Ipv4Address # The 'ipv4' address for the interface. Required for static configuration. (Pass in a string) $Ipv4AddressConfigMethod # Setting that determines how the 'ipv4' address is configured. Required if ipv4 is enabled. (Pass in a string) $Ipv6GatewayAddress # (Pass in a string) $NtpAcquisitionDescriptor # The configuration for the NTP on this management interface (Pass in a NtpAcquisitionDescriptor) $InterfaceName # Name of Ethernet port (Pass in a string) $SpeedSetting # The configured speed setting for the Ethernet interface. (Pass in a string) $ControllerRef # (Pass in a string) $Ipv4SubnetMask # The 'ipv4' subnet mask for the interface. Required for static configuration. (Pass in a string) $EnableRemoteAccess # If set to true, the controller is enabled for establishment of a remote access session. Depending on the controller platform, the method for remote access could be rlogin or telnet (Pass in a bool?) $Ipv6StaticRoutableAddress # (Pass in a string) $DnsAcquisitionDescriptor # The configuration for the DNS on this management interface (Pass in a DnsAcquisitionDescriptor) $Ipv6AddressConfigMethod # The method by which the 'ipv6' address information is configured for the interface. (Pass in a string) $InterfaceRef # Reference to the Ethernet interface to configure (Pass in a string) $Ipv4GatewayAddress # Manually specify the address of the gateway. (Pass in a string) $Ipv6LocalAddress # The 'ipv6' local address for the interface. (Pass in a string) $Ipv4Enabled # True if 'ipv4' is to be enabled for this interface; otherwise false. (Pass in a bool?) $Ipv6Enabled # True if 'ipv6' is to be enabled for this interface; otherwise false. (Pass in a bool?)
Update-NeConfigEthernetInterfaces ` -SystemId $SystemId ` -Ipv4Address $Ipv4Address ` -Ipv4AddressConfigMethod $Ipv4AddressConfigMethod ` -Ipv6GatewayAddress $Ipv6GatewayAddress ` -NtpAcquisitionDescriptor $NtpAcquisitionDescriptor ` -InterfaceName $InterfaceName ` -SpeedSetting $SpeedSetting ` -ControllerRef $ControllerRef ` -Ipv4SubnetMask $Ipv4SubnetMask ` -EnableRemoteAccess $EnableRemoteAccess ` -Ipv6StaticRoutableAddress $Ipv6StaticRoutableAddress ` -DnsAcquisitionDescriptor $DnsAcquisitionDescriptor ` -Ipv6AddressConfigMethod $Ipv6AddressConfigMethod ` -InterfaceRef $InterfaceRef ` -Ipv4GatewayAddress $Ipv4GatewayAddress ` -Ipv6LocalAddress $Ipv6LocalAddress ` -Ipv4Enabled $Ipv4Enabled ` -Ipv6Enabled $Ipv6Enabled

maml:description.maml:para: Discover StorageDevices on the network.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Starting IP address
Ending IP Address
In-band management agents will be queried if this value is true. If you are not sure, its best to leave this as default

Number of ports to use for discovery. A port is a file handler in most operating systems. Watch your ULimits. More ports the faster discovery goes. But, for example, windows only has a few thousand available ports. If file handlers are exceeded, then this process will adjust down but other processes on the server may be affected as well as client connections

Optional parameter. This defaults to 30 seconds. Longer times may be needed for WAN discoveries, but will slow down the whole process. Shorter times speed up the process. This is only the timeout value for the initial TCP connection
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Starting IP address
Ending IP Address
In-band management agents will be queried if this value is true. If you are not sure, its best to leave this as default

Number of ports to use for discovery. A port is a file handler in most operating systems. Watch your ULimits. More ports the faster discovery goes. But, for example, windows only has a few thousand available ports. If file handlers are exceeded, then this process will adjust down but other processes on the server may be affected as well as client connections

Optional parameter. This defaults to 30 seconds. Longer times may be needed for WAN discoveries, but will slow down the whole process. Shorter times speed up the process. This is only the timeout value for the initial TCP connection

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$StartIP # Starting IP address (Pass in a string) $EndIP # Ending IP Address (Pass in a string) $UseAgents # In-band management agents will be queried if this value is true. If you are not sure, its best to leave this as default (Pass in a bool?) $MaxPortsToUse # Number of ports to use for discovery. A port is a file handler in most operating systems. Watch your ULimits. More ports the faster discovery goes. But, for example, windows only has a few thousand available ports. If file handlers are exceeded, then this process will adjust down but other processes on the server may be affected as well as client connections (Pass in a int?) $ConnectionTimeout # Optional parameter. This defaults to 30 seconds. Longer times may be needed for WAN discoveries, but will slow down the whole process. Shorter times speed up the process. This is only the timeout value for the initial TCP connection (Pass in a int?)
Update-NeDiscovery ` -StartIP $StartIP ` -EndIP $EndIP ` -UseAgents $UseAgents ` -MaxPortsToUse $MaxPortsToUse ` -ConnectionTimeout $ConnectionTimeout

maml:description.maml:para: Create a Folder.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Optional List of rules used to define the folder. These rules are ANDed together Usually either rules OR a list of Ids are supplied.
Name of the folder
Optional list of storage system to include in the folder. Usually either rules OR a list of Ids are supplied.
Optional Parent folder Id for nested folders.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Optional List of rules used to define the folder. These rules are ANDed together Usually either rules OR a list of Ids are supplied.
Name of the folder
Optional list of storage system to include in the folder. Usually either rules OR a list of Ids are supplied.
Optional Parent folder Id for nested folders.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$Rules # Optional List of rules used to define the folder. These rules are ANDed together Usually either rules OR a list of Ids are supplied. (Pass in a List<Rule>) $Name # Name of the folder (Pass in a string) $StorageSystemIds # Optional list of storage system to include in the folder. Usually either rules OR a list of Ids are supplied. (Pass in a List<string>) $ParentId # Optional Parent folder Id for nested folders. (Pass in a string)
New-NeFolder ` -Rules $Rules ` -Name $Name ` -StorageSystemIds $StorageSystemIds ` -ParentId $ParentId

maml:description.maml:para: Add a storage-system.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
The world wide name for the storage system. This is only needed for in-band management with an in-band agent that is managing more than a single storage system.
A list of controller IP addresses or host names.
Optional meta tags to associate to this storage system
Enables validation of the added storage array. Returns errors if there are wwn mismatches or if the storage array cannot be contacted.
The SYMbol password for the storage system.
ID to assign to the storage system. This must be left null or be unique. If null, a unique ID will be assigned
Enable trace logging for SYMbol calls to the storage system.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
The world wide name for the storage system. This is only needed for in-band management with an in-band agent that is managing more than a single storage system.
A list of controller IP addresses or host names.
Optional meta tags to associate to this storage system
Enables validation of the added storage array. Returns errors if there are wwn mismatches or if the storage array cannot be contacted.
The SYMbol password for the storage system.
ID to assign to the storage system. This must be left null or be unique. If null, a unique ID will be assigned
Enable trace logging for SYMbol calls to the storage system.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$Wwn # The world wide name for the storage system. This is only needed for in-band management with an in-band agent that is managing more than a single storage system. (Pass in a string) $ControllerAddresses # A list of controller IP addresses or host names. (Pass in a List<string>) $MetaTags # Optional meta tags to associate to this storage system (Pass in a List<KeyValue>) $Validate # Enables validation of the added storage array. Returns errors if there are wwn mismatches or if the storage array cannot be contacted. (Pass in a bool?) $Password # The SYMbol password for the storage system. (Pass in a string) $Id # ID to assign to the storage system. This must be left null or be unique. If null, a unique ID will be assigned (Pass in a string) $EnableTrace # Enable trace logging for SYMbol calls to the storage system. (Pass in a bool?)
New-NeStorageSystem ` -Wwn $Wwn ` -ControllerAddresses $ControllerAddresses ` -MetaTags $MetaTags ` -Validate $Validate ` -Password $Password ` -Id $Id ` -EnableTrace $EnableTrace

$FolderId # (Pass in a string) $Rules # Optional List of rules used to define the folder. These rules are ANDed together Usually either rules OR a list of Ids are supplied.

maml:description.maml:para: Update a storage-system.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.

Optional meta tags to associate to this storage system. This must be a complete list. If the list is empty or null, no action is taken. If you want to just remove all tags, just set the removeAllTags boolean to true/ The removeAllTags will be processed before this new list is processed
Enable trace logging for SYMbol calls to the storage system.

The new password for the storage system stored. Note, this only updates the password stored on the proxy. To update the password on the storage system itself (as well as the stored password) the use the passwords URL
Replacement list of controller IP addresses or host names.
See the description for metaTags
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.

Optional meta tags to associate to this storage system. This must be a complete list. If the list is empty or null, no action is taken. If you want to just remove all tags, just set the removeAllTags boolean to true/ The removeAllTags will be processed before this new list is processed
Enable trace logging for SYMbol calls to the storage system.

The new password for the storage system stored. Note, this only updates the password stored on the proxy. To update the password on the storage system itself (as well as the stored password) the use the passwords URL
Replacement list of controller IP addresses or host names.
See the description for metaTags
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$SystemId # The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN. (Pass in a string) $MetaTags # Optional meta tags to associate to this storage system. This must be a complete list. If the list is empty or null, no action is taken. If you want to just remove all tags, just set the removeAllTags boolean to true/ The removeAllTags will be processed before this new list is processed (Pass in a List<KeyValue>) $EnableTrace # Enable trace logging for SYMbol calls to the storage system. (Pass in a bool?) $StoredPassword # The new password for the storage system stored. Note, this only updates the password stored on the proxy. To update the password on the storage system itself (as well as the stored password) the use the passwords URL (Pass in a string) $ControllerAddresses # Replacement list of controller IP addresses or host names. (Pass in a List<string>) $RemoveAllTags # See the description for metaTags (Pass in a bool?)
Update-NeStorageSystem ` -SystemId $SystemId ` -MetaTags $MetaTags ` -EnableTrace $EnableTrace ` -StoredPassword $StoredPassword ` -ControllerAddresses $ControllerAddresses ` -RemoveAllTags $RemoveAllTags

maml:description.maml:para: Expand a ThinVolume.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Unit for \"size\"
The new virtual capacity for the thin volume. New virtual capacity cannot be smaller than original value!

The new repository capacity of the thin volume. If expansion policy is Automatic, this will increase the maximum repository capacity. If the expansion policy is Manual, this will increase the capacity of the repository directly.
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Unit for \"size\"
The new virtual capacity for the thin volume. New virtual capacity cannot be smaller than original value!

The new repository capacity of the thin volume. If expansion policy is Automatic, this will increase the maximum repository capacity. If the expansion policy is Manual, this will increase the capacity of the repository directly.
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$SystemId # The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN. (Pass in a string) $Id # (Pass in a string) $SizeUnit # Unit for \"size\" (Pass in a string) $NewVirtualSize # The new virtual capacity for the thin volume. New virtual capacity cannot be smaller than original value! (Pass in a long?) $NewRepositorySize # The new repository capacity of the thin volume. If expansion policy is Automatic, this will increase the maximum repository capacity. If the expansion policy is Manual, this will increase the capacity of the repository directly. (Pass in a long?)
Update-NeThinVolumeExpand ` -SystemId $SystemId ` -Id $Id ` -SizeUnit $SizeUnit ` -NewVirtualSize $NewVirtualSize ` -NewRepositorySize $NewRepositorySize

maml:description.maml:para: Create a ThinVolume.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Maximum size (in sizeUnits) to which the thin volume repository can grow.
The user-label to assign to the new volume.

Number of units (See sizeUnit) to make the repository volume, which is the backing for the thin volume. Must be between 4GB & 256GB. This value must align along a 4GB boundary. If it does not, it will be automatically adjusted to the next 4GB value.
Optional array of Meta Data tags for the volume.
Create the default volume mapping. Defaults to false.
Set the preferred owning controller. By default this field will alternate between available controllers
Unit for \"size\"
Deprecated(This field is no longer valid for thin volumes): Enable/Disable automatic cache read-ahead
Initial virtual capacity of the volume in units (See sizeUnit).
The identifier of the storage pool from which the volume will be allocated.
Thin Volume expansion policy. If automatic, the thin volume will be expanded automatically when capacity is exceeded, if manual, the volume must be expanded manually. Defaults to automatic.
The repository utilization warning threshold (in percent). This parameter is only required for thin-provisioned volumes. Default: 95
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.
This is a Credential for the web service proxy, not the storage array. Use the Update-NePassword to set the password for the given storage array in the web service proxy.
Maximum size (in sizeUnits) to which the thin volume repository can grow.
The user-label to assign to the new volume.

Number of units (See sizeUnit) to make the repository volume, which is the backing for the thin volume. Must be between 4GB & 256GB. This value must align along a 4GB boundary. If it does not, it will be automatically adjusted to the next 4GB value.
Optional array of Meta Data tags for the volume.
Create the default volume mapping. Defaults to false.
Set the preferred owning controller. By default this field will alternate between available controllers
Unit for \"size\"
Deprecated(This field is no longer valid for thin volumes): Enable/Disable automatic cache read-ahead
Initial virtual capacity of the volume in units (See sizeUnit).
The identifier of the storage pool from which the volume will be allocated.
Thin Volume expansion policy. If automatic, the thin volume will be expanded automatically when capacity is exceeded, if manual, the volume must be expanded manually. Defaults to automatic.
The repository utilization warning threshold (in percent). This parameter is only required for thin-provisioned volumes. Default: 95
The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$SystemId # The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN. (Pass in a string) $MaximumRepositorySize # Maximum size (in sizeUnits) to which the thin volume repository can grow. (Pass in a long?) $Name # The user-label to assign to the new volume. (Pass in a string) $RepositorySize # Number of units (See sizeUnit) to make the repository volume, which is the backing for the thin volume. Must be between 4GB & 256GB. This value must align along a 4GB boundary. If it does not, it will be automatically adjusted to the next 4GB value. (Pass in a long?) $MetaTags # Optional array of Meta Data tags for the volume. (Pass in a List<VolumeMetadataItem>) $CreateDefaultMapping # Create the default volume mapping. Defaults to false. (Pass in a bool?) $OwningControllerId # Set the preferred owning controller. By default this field will alternate between available controllers (Pass in a string) $SizeUnit # Unit for \"size\" (Pass in a string) $CacheReadAhead # Deprecated(This field is no longer valid for thin volumes): Enable/Disable automatic cache read-ahead (Pass in a bool?) $VirtualSize # Initial virtual capacity of the volume in units (See sizeUnit). (Pass in a long?) $DataAssuranceEnabled # (Pass in a bool?) $PoolId # The identifier of the storage pool from which the volume will be allocated. (Pass in a string) $ExpansionPolicy # Thin Volume expansion policy. If automatic, the thin volume will be expanded automatically when capacity is exceeded, if manual, the volume must be expanded manually. Defaults to automatic. (Pass in a string) $GrowthAlertThreshold # The repository utilization warning threshold (in percent). This parameter is only required for thin-provisioned volumes. Default: 95 (Pass in a int?)
New-NeThinVolume ` -SystemId $SystemId ` -MaximumRepositorySize $MaximumRepositorySize ` -Name $Name ` -RepositorySize $RepositorySize ` -MetaTags $MetaTags ` -CreateDefaultMapping $CreateDefaultMapping ` -OwningControllerId $OwningControllerId ` -SizeUnit $SizeUnit ` -CacheReadAhead $CacheReadAhead ` -VirtualSize $VirtualSize ` -DataAssuranceEnabled $DataAssuranceEnabled ` -PoolId $PoolId ` -ExpansionPolicy $ExpansionPolicy ` -GrowthAlertThreshold $GrowthAlertThreshold
